message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product for sale. It's worth a lot to us, but I understand its value might be even greater to you. I'm willing to let you have it for $140. This is a great opportunity to get a high-quality item at a reasonable price. Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $130. I'm willing to pay a premium for a high-quality item, but I'm on a budget. Can you meet me in the middle at $130?

Thank you for your interest, Bob! I appreciate your budgetary considerations. I'd like to counter with an offer of $135 for the product. I believe this price reflects its high quality while still being fair to both of us.
I'm getting closer to your price, but I'm still not sure I can go that high. I'm willing to meet you at $132.50. Can we meet in the middle on this one?
I understand your position, Bob. I would like to counter with an offer of $134 for the product. I believe this price strikes a balance between fairness and value for both of us.
I'm still a bit hesitant, but I'm willing to meet you at $132. I think that's the best price I can go for. Can you consider that?

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Bob. I would like to counter with an offer of $133 for the product. I believe this price respects the value of the item while remaining within your budget.
I'm not sure I can go any lower, but I'll try one last time. I'll meet you at $131. That's the absolute maximum I'm willing to pay. Can you meet me there?
I see your position, Bob. I would like to counter with an offer of $132 for the product. I believe this price respects the value of the item while remaining within your budget constraints.
I'm not willing to go any higher, Alice. I'll meet you at $130, but that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to explore other options.
